natural solution: The given inequality is equivalent to \[\frac{1}{2x + 3} + 2 > 0,\]or \[\frac{4x + 7}{2x + 3} > 0.\]If $x < -\frac{7}{4},$ then $4x + 7 < 0$ and $2x + 3 < 0,$ so the inequality is satisfied. If $-\frac{7}{4} < x < -\frac{3}{2},$ then $4x + 7 > 0$ and $2x + 3 < 0,$ so the inequality is not satisfied.
If $x > -\frac{3}{2},$ then $4x + 7 > 0$ and $2x + 3 > 0,$ so the inequality is satisfied.
